thread.title_full: Stocks That Were In News On September 16, 2015

title: Stocks That Were In News On September 16, 2015
text:
The Sensex ended the day higher by 258 points, while the Nifty closed up by 70 points. On the global front, Asian markets ended the day on a positive note ahead U.S. Federal Reserve meet. 
Meanwhile, European counters were firm with CAC, DAX and FTSE all were trading in green. 
Suven Life Sciences 
Shares of Suven Life Sciences after the company announced it secures three product patents. Two from Canada and one from China for a drug used in the treatment of neuro-degenerative diseases 
Stock ended the day at Rs 241, higher by 4.27 per cent on BSE. It touched an intraday high of Rs 245 during the trade. 
Sun Pharma 
Shares of Sun Pharma rose over after the drug maker announced the acquisition of US-based eye care firm InSite Vision Inc. 
Stock ended the day at Rs 886, higher by 2.38 per cent on BSE. It touched an intraday high of Rs 291 during the trade. 
TVS Motor 
Shares of TVS Motor rose after a multiple block deals executed on the National Stock Exchange (NSE) and the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE). 
Stock ended the day at Rs 235, higher by 0.67 per cent on BSE. It touched an intraday high of Rs 241 during the trade. 
Vedanta 
The Anil Agarwal-led natural resources firm Vedanta Ltd. on Tuesday said it has received approvals from both the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) and the NSE on the company's proposal to merge with its hydrocarbons subsidiary Cairn India, reports PTI. 
Stock ended the day at Rs 98.95, higher by 2.12 per cent on BSE. It touched an intraday high of Rs 100.90 during the trade. 
IFCI 
The company said that it has made partial disinvestment to the extent of 1.5 percent of its stake in National Stock Exchange (NSE) i.e. 6,75,000 equity shares, to certain buyer on September 15. 
Stock ended the day at Rs20.80, lower by 0.24 per cent on BSE. It touched an intraday low of Rs 20.60 and high of Rs 21.30 during the trade.
